item.title: Quicklaunch
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

[quote=“nueb35, post:12, topic:185343”]instead of specifying the browser path try :

Runtime.getRuntime().exec("RUNDLL32 URL.dll,OpenURL " + url);

i believe that would work in windows but dunno in other OS’s[/quote]

  1. Again, why a OS dependent way for a OS independant language?
  2. java.awt.Desktop
  3. See 2

item.title: Quicklaunch
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:3, topic:185343”] } catch(Exception exception) { System.err.println(""); exception.printStackTrace(); }

Erm?

	browserPath = "C:/Program Files/Mozilla Firefox/firefox.exe";

Erm? What if the user uses Opera, or doesn’t have their default drive named C?[/quote]I edited my post, since I didn’t look at it…he made the whole thing OS dependent, which is stupid to do for a language like Java.

Read full topic

item.title: Quicklaunch
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

} catch(Exception exception) { System.err.println(""); exception.printStackTrace(); }

Erm?

	browserPath = "C:/Program Files/Mozilla Firefox/firefox.exe";

Erm? What if the user uses Opera, or doesn’t have their default drive named C?

Icon.[/quote]GG copying mitb with his moparscape advertising thing, and I guess this is nice, didn’t look at the source, just guessing it opens files/url you enter

Edit:

After looking at it, it’s OS specific, which is terrible for a OS-independent language like java.

You should look into the Desktop object.
